options.name: Hitman 2016
options.tooltip: Hitman 2016 lockpick, key, crowbar, and keycard animations (standing only). Unlocked doors will not open automatically.

options.name: Hitman 2016 (Hybrid)
options.tooltip: Hitman 2016 standing unlock animations, Hitman 2 and 3 crouching unlock animations. Unlocked doors will not open automatically.

options.name: Hitman 2 + Hitman 3
options.tooltip: Hitman 2 and 3 lockpick, key, crowbar, and keycard animations (standing and crouching). Unlocked doors will open automatically.

options.name: Hitman 2016 (Default)
options.tooltip: Most animations are extracted directly from Hitman 2016 (except for a few fixes/updates). The 2016 animations were created before briefcases were introduced in Hitman 2, resulting in visual issues. Aside from briefcases, this option has the best animation quality, transitions, and consistency.

options.name: Hitman 2016 (Classic)
options.tooltip: All animations are updated for briefcase support, except for the few with no identical replacements. This applies to climbing up 2 meters and certain animations that end with 47 standing (which allows crouching to be seamlessly cancelled).

options.name: Hitman 2016 (Modern)
options.tooltip: All animations are updated for briefcase support. Animations end with 47 standing or crouching depending on Hitman 3's selections. Climbing up 2 meters is slightly faster than in Hitman 2016, but the animations are otherwise unchanged.

options.name: Hitman 2016 (Original)
options.tooltip: All animations are extracted directly from Hitman 2016 (except for a few fixes/updates). The 2016 animations were created before briefcases were introduced in Hitman 2, resulting in visual issues. Aside from briefcases, this option has the best animation quality, transitions, and consistency.

options.name: Hitman 2016
options.tooltip: Hitman 2016 base cover animations, Hitman 2016 (pistol) and Hitman 2 arm poses. Pistol arm angles are slightly off, but this option has no side effects.

options.name: Hitman 2016 (Original)
options.tooltip: *CAUSES VISUAL ISSUES* Hitman 2016 base cover animations, Hitman 2016 (pistol) and Hitman 2 arm poses. Pistol arm angles are authentic, but this option causes visual issues with certain animations for carrying large items.

options.name: Hitman 2
options.tooltip: Hitman 2016 base cover animations, Hitman 2 arm poses. Used in older versions of the mod.

options.name: Hitman 3
options.tooltip: Hitman 3 cover animations (with 2016 acrobatics).

options.name: Hitman 3 (Hybrid)
options.tooltip: Hitman 3 cover animations (with 2016 acrobatics), combined with Hitman 2016 standing pistol arm poses. 2016 pistol arm angles are slightly off, but this option has no side effects.

options.name: Hitman 2016
options.tooltip: Hitman 2016 animations for equipping and unequipping weapons/items. All 2016 animations that meet high enough standards of quality are in use.

options.name: Hitman 2016 (Modern)
options.tooltip: Hitman 2016 animations for equipping and unequipping weapons/items. All 2016 animations that meet high enough standards of quality are in use. Uses physics simulation for smoother transitions when unequipping two-handed weapons.

options.name: Hitman 2016 (Original)
options.tooltip: Hitman 2016 animations for equipping and unequipping weapons/items. All 2016 animations without serious visual issues are in use, including slightly problematic ones.

options.name: Hitman 2
options.tooltip: Hitman 2 animations for equipping and unequipping weapons/items. Uses physics simulation for smoother transitions when unequipping two-handed weapons.

options.name: Hitman 3
options.tooltip: Hitman 3 animations for equipping and unequipping weapons/items. These are the animations from the vanilla game.

options.name: Hitman 2016 + Hitman 2
options.tooltip: Hitman 2016 and Hitman 2 animations for firing all weapons.

options.name: Hitman 3
options.tooltip: Hitman 3 animations for firing all weapons.

options.name: Default (Recommended)
options.tooltip: Uses standard arm behavior that flows smoothly, but has the vanilla Hitman 2 and 3 bug that stops the walking pistol arm pose at random.

options.name: 2016 (Experimental)
options.tooltip: *CAUSES VISUAL ISSUES* Fixes the vanilla Hitman 2 and 3 bug that stops the walking pistol arm pose at random, but causes other visual bugs with weapon handling.
